Modern definition: relating to schools, colleges, and universities, or connected with studying and thinking, not with practical skills
Example: academic subjects / books / institution

Modern definition: used to describe someone who is clever and enjoys studying
Example: The school is noted for its academic excellence.

Modern definition: based on ideas and theories and not related to practical effects in real life
Example: a purely academic argument / question

Modern definition: someone who teaches at a college, or who studies as part of their job
the process of teaching or learning, especially in a school or college, or the knowledge that you get from this
Example: As a child he received most of his education at home.

Modern definition: AmE. the study of methods and theories of teaching
Example: She has a master’s degree in early childhood education.

Modern definition: the act of looking at or considering something carefully in order to discover something
Example: I had to have / undergo a medical examination when I joined the pension scheme.

Modern definition: a formal test that you must pass in order to earn a particular qualification or to be allowed to do a particular job (an exam)
Example: to take / pass / fail an examination

Modern definition: the person who is responsible for managing an organization or whose job is to organize sports team / singer / actor
Example: a bank / station / store / football manager

Modern definition: spec. computer program or system that helps you to control or organize a particular type of activity
Example: You can click on a file in the file manager.

Modern definition: relating to work that needs special training or education
Example: Chris, you're a nurse, so can I ask your professional opinion on bandaging ankles?

Modern definition: having the qualities that you connect with trained and skilled people, such as effectiveness, skill, organization, and seriousness of manner
Example: She always looks very professional in her smart suits.

Modern definition: used to describe someone who does a job that people usually do as a hobby
Example: She's a professional dancer / photographer.

Modern definition: a person who has the type of job that needs a high level of education and training
Example: health professionals

Modern definition: informal. someone who has worked hard in the same type of job for a long time and has become skilled at dealing with any problem that might happen
Example: I thought the whole meeting was going to fall apart but you rescued it like a true professional!

Modern definition: a person who does a job that people usually do as a hobby
Example: He's only been playing football as a professional for two years.

Modern definition: a place where children go to be educated or a where people can study a particular subject
Example: a primary / secondary / driving / dancing school

Modern definition: a part of a college or university specializing in a particular subject or group of subjects
Example: the School of Oriental and African Studies

Modern definition: a group of painters, writers, poets, etc. whose work is similar, especially similar to that of a particular leader
Example: the Impressionist school of painting

Modern definition: to train a person or animal to do something
Example: It takes a lot of patience to school a dog / horse.

Modern definition: (knowledge from) the careful study of the structure and behaviour of the world, especially by doing experiments
Example: Space travel is one of the wonders of modern science.

Modern definition: a person who is learning at a school, college or university
Example: Teachers use a variety of materials to inspire their students.

Modern definition: someone whose job is to teach in a school or college
Example: The teacher drew a diagram showing how the blood flows through the heart.

Modern definition: a place of higher education where people study for an undergraduate (= first) or postgraduate (= higher level) degree
Example: She applied to six universities and was accepted by three.
